Remember this show?  youtube.com/watch?v=l5A2…   Jubilee Juice is very similar. Well...except for the fact that instead of weird human/animal hybrids the main focus is delicious fruit drink fusions. Actually, the two really have nothing to do with one another, but their titles kinda sound similar, and I'd never waste a somewhat relevant opportunity to add a creepy Zoobilee Zoo clip to a review.  All joking aside though, the place is great for more than just smoothies. The menu is way larger than you'd expect and the food was very legit. The Jubilee chicken sandwich was totally tasty, and I love the fact that instead of fries you can get several other options on the side such as steamed veggies, spinach pie, or marinated asparagus. Makes it much easier to eat healthy in these summer months.  Overall it's a tad pricey, but I really don't mind paying a little more for healthy alternatives that are delicious. Go. Enjoy, and without fear of those creepy characters from the clip.

Home at 2:30a. Hungry and no food (or have food but no interest or coordination to cook). Solution is here. Great menu, variety and the food was very good. I had the Reuben sandwich which got here quickly and hot so no sog factor. And they have the brains to package the sauces on the side. They told us 45 mins. but the food got here in about 25. My new late nite food delivery has been bookmarked.

Absolutely loved my turkey burger.  It was a weekday evening and I was starving after coming out of a late work event.  I was so glad that I chose Jublilee Juice to satisfy my starvation.  I could not wait to get home and sink my teeth into this warm, nicely wrapped in foil burger--yummy!  I also had a side of waffle fries and they were the perfect combo with the tasty turkey burger.  I have to admit that I love feeling full after I eat, especially on my more ravenous days.  This burger definitely satisfied the taste buds and the growling tummy!

It feels a little weird to write a 5-star review for a late night food place, but there is a serious dearth of options out there, and after 2am, this place is like a godsend. The best part is that there are really healthy options! I got a grilled chicken wrap on a spinach tortilla... with bacon... and cheese... and mayo.... but it was def healthier than most of the other options out there!! And sooooo good! They have tons of options, and you can customize everything. The juices are also great, albeit a little more expensive than my local place.  One gripe (not really a gripe) is that when you order on GrubHub, they don't tell you that the fries are waffle fries. Had I known that, I would not have hesitated for the 4 seconds that I did before ordering them. Jubilee - if you've got it, flaunt it!! Waffle fries!!! So good. Makes me want to go out late tonight so I can order again.

I love their Smoothies. Best in the City if you ask me. Can't go wrong with the food either. You have to try their Chicken Divine and Honey Mustard Chicken. Can't go wrong with either. They're a bit pricey but it's worth it.

I love the fact that they make fresh juice here. 2nd time stopping in this joynt. Love the burgers and the Mahi Mahi sandwich is real good. Brought some friends here couple weeks ago late night, and they all loved it! Great place to stop late night and grab a quick bite to eat. Better then a burrito joynt after hours. The women at the counter needs to smile more and be a bit nicer, not very friendly. However, i will be back since I love food and this place hits the spot. DONT park next door in the lot, you will get towed. I parked there and asked them if it was okay and they said I needed to go immediately and repark it or my car could get towed. You can park in front on odd hours. Not much parking unless you park in front 15 minute loading zone during certain hours or along randolph and walk. Looking forward to trying something new next time I go.

I was all set to make this establishment one of my frequent haunts.  I've had two very successful ordering-in experiences with Jubilee Juice & Grill, but the last will be my last.  Had a VERY rude young lady answer the telephone last Friday evening, who automatically quoted their non-delivery until after 9:00 p.m. policy, and then abruptly hung up the telephone in my face when I paused to ask another question.  Given her broken command of the English language, the woman seemed foreign, as is this place's concept of customer service.  I now get my smoothie and sandwich fix from one of their competitors.

i stayed away from here before because of the appearance, but i'm sick of tacos in pilsen and jubilee is on my way home from work. i got the jubilee chicken and a side order of hummus (i dont care if its "expensive," dont order it if you dont think its worth it). what i ordered was definitely worth it. the goat cheese was delicious with the moist chicken, and the hummus was fresh and tasty (a bit stingy on the pita). definitely will be stopping by regularly. when i ordered, i liked that they asked me when i was going to arrive, instead of telling me a time. i told them fifteen minutes, so they said ok, we'll start your food in ten. awesome!

Grilled asparagus sandwich with goat cheese on french bread.  Can I just say one thing?  AMAZING. The asparagus was freshly grilled, slightly crunchy, nicely seasoned, just like I like!  And anything with goat cheese is rockin' in my book.  The bread, a nice crusty piece of french bread, was the perfect compliment.  This little hole in the wall has my vote!  No wonder this sandwich was in the Tribune's 30 best sandwiches!  I feel like a doo-doo.  I didn't try any juice.  Hello, JUICE & GRILL?!?!  Why didn't I?  Oh, well, reason to go back again!!!  Don't let the outside fool you!  This place is da bomb.

Jubilee Juice is now open until 4 am Mon-Fri and 5 am on Saturday. What's not to like?  I'm just in town for biz but my work hours are weird and I end up being done with my day around midnight.  It's nice to get a veggie burger and smoothie so late at night!   Service was nice, all the employees were friendly even at 1 am.   Yeah, it's a little more expensive than I might expect.  For late night, I think it is very reasonable.  Working late sucks and these guys have to work even later than me so I appreciate them and it's okay for me to pay 6.50 for a veggie burger.  My peach smoothie was too sweet (can't say I didn't enjoy it though, I just felt like I was cheating) -- so I think I'll just go with a juice next time.
Ok i dont know if its healthy but the sandwiches and cheese fries have got me by the balls. I fiend for their food like a drug addict.

Healthy? Kind of. Affordable? No. Worth it? If you need a wheat grass shot, or a quick bite that is not laden with grease, then yes. I used to live kinda close to here and would stop in on my way home from school. The owner is some kind of eastern European guy, their prices used to be what draws me in but now, its the rejected eastern European models who work the register.  This place is pretty decent. I usually get: Ahi Tuna Sand. - White bread & no sauce = kind of bland and not that healthy. But I get it anyway because it comes with a large salad and 2 onion rings. Which is weird, why do they give 2 onion rings? With a fish sandwich? And they are underneath the sandwich halves.....OH i just got it, its to keep the sandwich warm and dry? Maybe? Smoothies - All the smoothies I have had here are great. I am pretty sure they are loaded with sugar and def not made from fresh fruit, but whatever, I pretend to work out.  Wheat Grass - this is the saving grace of this place. If you feel bloated or sick or fat or whatever, just take a shot of wheat grass juice and you will feel great. I love it before or after my workout. Its equivalent to like 3 lbs of raw veggies, and its the one shot that will keep you sober and you still vomit.  They have a large menu, with a lot of unhealthy choices, but if you want to have a healthy bite here, you can.

I don't know what it is about a sweatin' it out, but I've been craving post-workout smoothies like nobody's business.  Jubilee wasn't a far walk so that's where my wobbly legs took me.   It doesn't look like much from the outside or the inside for that matter.  It's like the juice bar & grill equivalent of a dive bar.  It could use a face lift.  Aside from the superficial things, their smoothie menu looked pretty good.  They even had boost shots: whey protein, ginseng, C-complex, ginkgo, echinacea, etc. I ordered a 24 oz pineapple craze.  Strawberries, bananas, pineapple, plain yogurt and pineapple sherbet & juice.  A 24 oz is the smallest size you can get ($5.50) for just over $6 after tax.  It is one monster of a smoothie.  I could have been satisfied with half as much...at half the price too.  It still amazes me that 24 oz is considered a small.  I could do a 24 oz soda or beer no problem, but a smoothie is pretty filling.  Nonetheless, it was so good and hit the spot.  I'll be back...there are 15 other smoothies to try.

I will keep this short and simple.  This place is simple and AWESOME.  Great sandwiches ( I tried them all) and it opens late in to the night.  And yes, WAFFLE FRIES.  Definitely a healthier alternative compared to other delivery places.

Never went to this place and always got delivery...but, this place has great food - maybe it's a bit on the expensive side, but it gets you full and happy. Such as... Tonight, I got a chicken cheddar and bacon sandwich, complete with a piña colada smoothie/shake and waffle fries. With a large lemonade it was a bit over $20. Yeah, it's expensive, but the sandwich was huge with decent amounts of grilled onions, cheddar cheese, nicely sized chicken breast, on a tasty bun. The piña colada smoothie was sweet and (why didn't I put some rum in there, duh!), and the waffle fries were delish - even when it cooled off, it was still very edible! A rare thing! I've eaten here for years for River North delivery, and it's good food - oh and the delivery is fairly speedy too btw. Packaging of all items were well done without leakage. If you want quantity and some good quality, hit this place...shakes and smoothies are generally good, and sandwiches & waffle fries tasty! I know I'll be finishing the sandwich for breakfast! Can't wait!

Best. Waffle Fries. EVER!  Seriously, I think instead of salt, they sprinkle crack on the waffle fries. I live in Portage Park on the Northwest side of the City and I will drive to the West Loop, just for the waffle fries. An order of waffle fries is a pretty big portion. Have I mentioned the waffle fries are amazing?  Ok, ok, enough about the crack-tastic waffle fries, they have other stuff too. I love that they have a decent and tasty vegetarian menu. From a basic veggie burger to grilled vegetables, they have several great sandwiches to choose from. All the sandwiches have been more than filling (sometimes, I can only eat half and save the other half for lunch the next day). My meat eating friends have said that their other sandwiches are also good. All sandwich orders can be upgraded to a combo meal with a fountain drink and (yep, you guessed it) waffle fries or a smoothie and waffle fries for an additional charge. The smoothies and juices are freshly made and delish.  A bit of warning, all food is made to order so sometimes there is a bit of a wait. This is especially true around lunch time. Between the occasional wait, slightly high (but not crazy) prices, and the sometimes less than friendly staff (ok, it only happened a few times). I give 4 out of 5 stars-- The pluses are worth the drive...tasty sammies and of course WAFFLE FRIES!!

Jubilee Juice is a cool fast food place to get a delicious smoothie (not healthy at all because most of them have ice cream), a burger/chicken sandwich or wrap - I usually stop by here if I'm in the area and I'm hungry - haven't had anything that I didn't like. One of my favorite menu items is the chicken divine - the chicken is seasoned with white wine, and it has sauteed mushrooms and vegetables, all served w/cheese in a pita. Yum. If you need a quick, tasty snack, Jubilee Juice is a good option.

It's nice to have a fresher, healthier alternative to fast food in the neighborhood. You can tell the quality of the place is much better than your average fast-food type place. I like the concept of the place. So far I've tried the smoothies, the salads, and the sandwiches, and they were all good.  My only hesitation in giving it a higher rating are the prices. I suppose you just have to pay more for better quality, but just a veggie sandwich and an iced tea will cost you over $10 with tax (chips not included). And a small smoothie costs over $6 with tax. Prices are a bit steep, but that won't keep me from coming back. It just keeps me from coming here all the time.

I was pleasantly surprised by this west loop location. Their name is Jubilee Juice, so I was surprised when my co-workers told me they have a great menu. I went with the strawberry salad. Chicken, spinach, gargonzola, almonds, strawberry's and a strawberry vin. The best salad I've had in a long time. People probably have no idea this place makes for a great lunch option, although the don't deliver farther than a few blocks. CHECK IT OUT!!
i come here for lunch almost everyday i work in the city. the veggie wrap is AMAZING!!!!!!! The place is pretty clean...everything is fresh and healthy. Definitly a good place for lunch! :)

If it's fresh squeezed juice on the go you're after than this is your place! Carrot ginger juice is refreshing and packs a punch...the perfect afternoon treat, especially in the summer. With some delicious, healthy juices on their menu you'd expect the food to follow suit, right? Not so much. I was underwhelmed by the roasted veggie sandwich I had. Good veggies but SO much bread I and dressing I ended up just eating the yummy zucchini bits with a fork. It would be nice if they added some tasty/healthy options to compliment the juices.

They raised their prices, but they are still  great place. If I don't have a pineapple craze once a week, I get depressed. Also good: soups, combo beef and sausage, philly steak, burger, fries (among the best in the city).

This place is ok...the only reason we stopped in is because it is the only place open past 9pm in this damn neighborhood. God forbid you work late like my BF, who doesn't get home until 9:30 some nights, and you need a bite to eat. Once this place shuts down at 10pm, you're screwed.  Either way, their smoothies are pretty good, however i'm not sure about the food. It was average at best. I ordered a buffalo chicken sandwich and specifically asked for crumbled blue cheese instead of the gross liquid dressing. They opted to not include any cheese on my sando. ooook maybe they didn't hear me. Three weeks later, same thing! ok maybe I wasn't clear the 1st time but how do you screw up the same order twice?  Normally when issues like this arise, I pleasantly walk back over and tell them they need to fix my food pronto, however it was below zero outside and despite the fact that I live all of 5 blocks away, there is no way in hell I'm fighting through anartica to take that food back. Maybe they are on to something :-/

I just two Rubens and soda. How can someone mess up a sandwich is beyond me, but wouldn't one think to put the thousand island on the side if the sandwich is being wrapped in foil, and then sent out on delivery? I spent $20 and waited an hour for a heap of slop. The bread was all wet and gooey, I couldn't even eat it. I am so pissed and still hungry. I have ordered the spinach pie from here religiously, but now forget this place.

Just finished my Jubilee burger, with goat cheese and sauce paired with waffle fries and fresh lemonade.  Everything was great.  I've had this before and it does have a surprising menu. But I guess it does have Juice in its name. THIS is FRESH lemonade! They could cut the price slightly, $4.95 but about a size medium. Delivery, however, took an hour and maybe some minutes in there too. For real?? And the woman on the phone seemed a little, uh, out of it.  But I am a repeat customer and I also tried the tropical passion drink which was like a sweet tart with freshness!

Had the Strawberry Heaven smoothie, it was alright.  I probably shouldn't have gotten something with apple juice so it ended up not really having any bold flavors.  For the price I don't think I would go back.

When I work late and needed to grab something healthy after 9pm, Jubilie was the best option.  Great vegetarian selection, salads are great, and they have a vegetable juicer.  Order just about anything and pick it up in 10 minutes.  My husband also loves the dolmades and the halibut.

I've been coming here since a co-worker recommended it about five years ago. I love this place! I've tried everything on the menu my faves are the chicken ceasar salad and the goat cheese quesadilla. I'm not a huge fan of their burgers but I know people who love them. I've recommended this place to a lot of people and they always rave about the smoothies. My favorites are the orange berry dream, pina colada, and the cranberry pleasure.  I could eat here everyday and never get tired. LOVE IT!

Love their marinated grilled chicken wrap and their waffle fries are delicious!  Best part is they deliver!  I also really like that you can order online...so quick and easy!  Haven't had a meal there that I didn't like!

Ya- it's a little on the pricey side but they give you a lot of food! This time I tried the All American Burger and it  was outstanding--Good Pickles/Fried Onion/Mayo/Lettuce/Tomato. This place has probably the BEST Cheese Waffle Fries in the City Of Chicago! They use Merkt's Cheddar Cheese, not some watered down low grade bullshit.. They Are The Real DEAL! FIND THEM/Ultimate Hangover cure...GTFJD

This place is great!  I always thought it was some sort of greasy-spoon take-out place, but I was oh-so-wrong.  Really, it's a smorgasbord of fresh and delicious juices, smoothies, sandwiches, salads, burgers, wraps and desserts. My favorite afternoon treat (besides chocolate or coffee) is their fresh-squeezed pear/orange/carrot juice. The service is pretty good, too.  Their employees always seem rather tired or uninterested in the customers, but who cares.  They're prompt and they're quick and they make good food!

This spot is a little (okay, a lot) pricey for what should ostensibly just be a sandwich & juice shop, but, at least the size of the food is proportionate to what you pay for it.   The sandwiches are all just a bit too big, but, hell, you jump up and down a few times and you can fit them in.  The grilled chicken offerings come on this nice soft crumble in your face home made bread, which is really good.  Of these, I usually just get the marinated chicken.  I'm also a fan of their turkey reuben, which comes loaded with enough turkey to make a stereotypical early American pilgrim start salivating with delight.  The waffle fries are truly a delight, and I say that as someone who has never liked waffle fries from any other place in her life, ever. Seriously.  Usually waffle fries get too much of the sog action, but Jubilee's are always fresh and crispy, without any nasty grease trap flavors. I also have to give a shout out to the huge cups of carrot juice.  I love carrot juice, I would drink nothing else if I wouldn't turn bright orange.  They whip it up for you tout de suite and then (if you're me) you can start sucking it down so fast it's gone before you get home.

After having a smoothie here no other smoothie will quench your thirst.  Love the Mango Madness.  Love having a punchcard where the 10th smoothie is free.  Goat cheese quesidilla, salads, fresh orange juice, mahi sandwich and some of the best soups.  This is our local "fast food" and with such fresh ingredients and lots of meatless choices you don't feel bad eating here.  The staff is always friendly and even accomodates my dislike of plastic containers putting my food in my steel tiffin for me.  I will warn you that the smoothies run on the higher end of the money scale but for good reason.  There is a parking lot right next to it if you are planning on not staying long too.  Worth the stop.  If my meat-loving, fried food BF can be satisfied here and me a veggie loving fruithead too it is a must try!

Wow, the smoothies are amazing here.  The ultimate indulgence?  Waffle Cut Cheese Fries, with melted Merkts Cheese spread for dipping...mmmmm.   Great sandwiches and very high quality ingredients.  A great place.

WOW WEE!  FRESH FOOD!   The best turkey burger ever!!!! I had the Avocado Turkey Burger with swiss cheese, grilled onion and tomato's.  Made with fresh  1/2 pound hand press ground turkey with diced jalapeño and seasoning. The bun is lightly grilled with a hint of garlic.    The average price is $7.50 for a sandwich, but well worth it because of the huge portion!   Freshly made juice.  Lemonade with a shot of ginger, great combo.

How could I live across the street from them and never go in? Craving some veggie juice I strolled my way into jubilee juice. Ordered my carrot , celery, and pear juice and was on my way. On a hot day how refreshing and healthy. Their menu definitely looks good I will check it out real soon!!! I highly recommend the juice its awesome!!!!

I love Jubilee. Their burgers are huge and extremely filling, but I really enjoyed their fresh squeezed vegetable juice.  I think parking is an issue if you drive, but I work nearby so its not an issue for me.  Their chicken sandwiches are very good also. I highly recommend Jubilee!!!!

JJ & G has vegetarian options!!! I like the veggie burger and the fries are sooo good. Word to the wise, ask them to add whatever condiments and extras you would normally eat on a burger and be prepared to pay extra as they do not come with... all you get is ranch dressing, lettuce, and tomato.....

The chicken burger and waffle fries rock! Very big portions. A little pricey but the quality of the food makes it worth it. I have not tried any of the smoothies, but they look very good, and people are always ordering them.

I am addicted to the "Strawberry Heaven" smoothie! I work right around the block from here and it takes everything in me not to stop here every morning. It is honestly one of the best smoothies I have ever had, and all of the ones on their menu sound so good. I also really like their homemade chocolate chip cookies, and when you go first thing when they open they are HOT and FRESH out of the oven.   We have gotten take out here a couple times but I have only tried the turkey burger. Not only was it really good, but it was massive! I had some to enjoy for later ;). I have also heard that the chicken burgers and their chicken sandwiches are good. Glad I finally tried it but not too happy about what their smoothies are doing to my wallet.
Dude.  15 minutes for a peach smoothie easy banana that tastes nothing like peach for almost seven bucks.  Bite me.

First time there today. Delicious Peach Refresher. Yummy fresh grilled vegetables. Although quite pricey for a take-out place. Walk there if you can, there's no parking. Other than that, definitely go back.

I used to go here all the time.  It was never exactly cheap for what you got, but they d0 have a better selection and better ingredients than a lot of similar places that I would classify as not quite fast food places.  I really had sticker shock when I was in here and my whole meal was almost $20.  I could have spent less with tip at a regular sit down place.  I still may have to stop in once in a while to get those addictive waffle fries with cheese, but the impulse buys on the mediocre sandwiches and salads are no more.

Oh Man. I miss working near this place, their waffle fries and Turkey Burgers are so good.  Their smoothies are great too, my husband and I would come here before driving back home to the burbs.  Talk about dashboard dining, this was food that you could never pass up, especially after a busy day at the office when you don't have time to eat!  You'll totally fill up and really worth the money to spend on great "fast" food.

I don't eat here often because it doesn't really jive with the diet I always seem to be on, but when I do I really enjoy it. They have tasty and sizable burgers with a variety of toppings.  I also like the chicken sandwiches just as much.  You can get all the same toppings on those.  Their fries are good, and I actually like the cheese you can get with them.  Its real cheese, which is a bit jarring at first because you are so used to getting nasty fake movie theater cheese, but its good stuff. Anyway, its probably the best place around to get a decent burger.  I would ideally give it a review more in the 3.5 range, but it is more deserving of a 4 than a 3.  Check it out!

The food is absolutely amazing. The grilled chicken sandwiches are tasty, juicy and huge. The waffle fries are really great too. The only complaint are the girls that work there. They are not very friendly and always look miserable.

I'm pretty confident the turkey burgers here have crack in them. They're so good it's hard for me to order a turkey burger anywhere else because I'm so scared of another crappy frozen patty. Their meat is made fresh with all sorts of good things inside, spices, peppers, onions, etc. I'm totally addicted to them to the point I can't even order anything else off the menu when I go there. It is a little bit pricey and the delivery area is rather small but it is well worth the trip. Everyone I've sent there for a turkey burger has repeated exactly what I wrote above. These are crack burgers.

I only ate here once and I was in a rush, so Jubilee was a random, quick stop on my way to an appointment. But the grilled chicken sandwich was one of the best I ever had. Big, juicy and awesome. That's all I have to say about that.

This place has phenomenal chicken sandwiches. They are massive and oh so good. The waffle fries indeed are the best. And the salads aren't too shabby either. The only problem with the salads it once you add the meat they aren't so cheap. The veggie burger is also surprisingly good. This is my go to spot for a quick bite when I'm too lazy to cook.  They have just about everything to choose from, burgers, chicken sammies, salads, grilled cheese, cold meat sammies, you name it.
BEST! WAFFLE FRIES! EVER! I love the grilled Turkey & Chedder (hold the dressing). So freakin yummy!  Minus 1 star cause the fountain Cokes are too syrupy and sugary. But I love this place!

The jubilee chicken is absolutely outstanding!! The marinade they use for the chicken is wonderful and between the large bun and goat cheese.. I can't get enough.  My bf eats the avocado burger and raves about it just as much!  They have great sides ranging from steamed asparagus to cheddar waffle cheese fries!  I enjoy eating here every time but I am giving this place 3 stars because they are so darn expensive and the girls that work there could be a little more pleasant.
I love their waffle fried and smoothies. I don't like their service. They tend to be pretty rude and have messed my order up on several occasions. It is a healthier choice for fast food!

Terrible service.  Been in several times, sometimes there are 10 people behind the counter, other times it's just one but in either case, prepare to be ignored.  I have also ordered for delivery and they forgot my fries. I called to inquire about it and was hung up on, twice. Great customer service.

I had the grilled portabello sandwich with romaine lettuce and goat's cheese. Yes it was that good. To boot, I washed it down with a carrot, apple, and beet juice. I felt healthy and my pee was an awesome shade of purple. Now try to market that interesting fact.

Sure, the decor is a disaster and cheezier than a carnival. Yeah, the employees are tired of listening to my jubilant salutations as they craft Bacon Chicken Cheddar Sandwiches in the background. I figure they cater to the in-and-out work crowd because they aren't the best customer service representatives so please disreguard the bored employees. One night at 8:55pm, after wrapping the work day up, I decided to call for delivery. They delivery guys shift ends at 9pm and he still came through. The fresh squeezed orange juice and lemonades are a keeper. They waffle fries are the best in town guaranteed and keeps me a loyal fan.

2 blocks from my house, smoothies and wheat grass, and a non-fried fish sandwich for under 15? umm wonderful. the greek owners smoke in the eating area when no one is there? love it.! ...but, there bread is just icky buns, and what ever meat is in the pre made burgers made my bf sick for 2 days.  If you are in the neighborhood and want something besides a gyro, it is a decent alternative. My advice, avoid the burgers.

This place is the perfect hangover cure--for when you're too tired to make it out to breakfast, but you still want that greasy spoon-type food. And best of all, the entire menu brags about being fresh, healthy and mostly organic...so even if it's not REALLY healthy (waffle fries, burgers and salads with tons of cheese and meat--eh, not so much on the "good for you" side of things), you can tell yourself it is because it's all washed down with a huge styrofoam jug of "freshly" blended juice (tacking on 1,000 calories--but making you feel 1,000x less hungover). They also carry Kettle Chips (a boutique and therefore "healthier" kind of chip) in about 18 varieties at the checkout stand, so if you're hungry while you wait for your waffle fries (with cheese sauce on the SIDE) and buffalo chicken salad (dressing on the SIDE), you can keep the hunger demons at bay. The menu is huge, and has ridiculous names like Citrus Nirvana, Savvy Steak, Veggie Victory, etc., but everything is delicious and they do substitutions very well.  The only downside about this place is that it's never opened at 2 in the morning when I need it most.

Jubilee Juice is a jewel in the West Loop.  Absolutely yummy healthy sandwiches and drink in a tiny, simple, unpretentious restaurant.  I love their Dolmades (stuffed grape leaves)!  Lots of good food for a very reasonable price, and the owner is a really nice, friendly guy.  I've never had a bad experience...

I'm obsessed with their marinated chicken. The sandwiches are delicious and everything there is really fresh. Turkey Burger made onsite, as well as veggie burger. Plus they have a ton of vegetarian stuff.  You can order all types of grilled meats to go on top of your salads as well as Merkt's cheese spread for your cheese fries (waffle cut) or anything for that matter. It's kind of a weird spot but I think the food is great and delivery is super quick. Delivery of fresh juices? Perfect. You're not really gonna want to eat here, but their food is great. Ordering online is a breeze too!

I eat here for lunch once a week usually.  They have an amazing turkey burger.  I get that if I'm super hungry but usually opt for the stuffed vine leaves to pick at and grab a berry smoothie with a boost.  U might want to order ahead of time for a pick-up b/c they are usually pretty busy at lunch time.  Plus the place is tiny so kind of awkward waiting.  Just a suggestion though:)  Really good lunch spot!

I order delivery from this place pretty often. The smoothies are exceptional and I usually just order an appetizer.  I did order a sandwich once that was just ok.  The delivery is exceptionally fast and the food is clearly fresh.   I will continue to order.

If this place were just a little less pricey - it would be a 5 star. That being said the smoothies and the food are absolutely knock-out, 5-star, delicious. I am a VERY VERY picky eater and I will admit that. This place is unbelievable.  I always order to go when I am in the neighborhood because the inside is a bit small. But the menu is also 5-star. I am a repeat customer, and if you go once - you'll be hooked.

The only reason this place is 4-star is because of the seating decor, comfort, and availability.  It is the ONLY fast food place I go to in my neighborhood anymore (well maybe Perez., too...), but I place my order for pick up. Their burger is creative, enormous, and tasty as all get out, and a fresh batch of fries is the norm, not the exception. Their chicken sandwiches are amazing as well.  I recommend cutting their sandwiches in half, they are THAT big.  The grilled veggies are as good as reviewed below.  I have personally seen them make the juices, and can attest there are no fillers - just fruit juice.  Their staff... well some people below have a point, but they have never been rude - they just think you are dumb for not knowing what you want to eat.

Had the standard grilled chicken sandwich here and it was AMAZING. Very good portion and the bun was good too. Do yourself a favor. Not much in atmosphere, probably plan on grabbing this to go. Great food!

I was starving after my nail job, and thought that I light dinner or maybe even a liquid one would be palatable - or at least hold me over until I could get home to make something to eat.  This place seems to keep busy, and offers quite an extensive menu.  I ordered an Italian sandwich that was very filling and pretty tasty.  I also got the crab and pepper soup.  It was tasty, but I didn't feel like there was a lot of substance in there.  It could very well be that it was closer to the end of the day.  The prices are average, but the staff wasn't as helpful as I thought they'd be.  I wanted to hear input on what was good, but she seemed to struggle over an answer to give me.

In the middle of my chicken burrito kick, i decided to try to have a healthy lunch before I go back to stuffing my face with chicken burritos. So, I went to Jubilee, near my office, which sounded like the most promising place to get something other than the old Mid-West standby: Meat + Cheese. For $6.50 you get a big box of grilled mixed vegetables on a bed of green with two sides of dressing. It takes a good minute to make, but fresh vegetables: zuchinni, yellow squash, asparagus, red pepper and eggplant, grilled with no oil or anything. It was DELISH.  I also had a carrot, beet and celery juice. I know that sounds weird but its actually really good. Carrots and beets are really sweet, skip the celery if you want. If you're too scared of vegetables because you were raised on beef and potatoes, give an apple + carrot juice a try, so yum! I'm glad that this place exists where it does so I have an option when I feel like my liver and heart are really mad at me. Really fresh food at fair prices.

I went to Jubilee and the food is good.  I love, love, love the waffle fries.  Kind of takes me back to my Chick-Fil-A days in Texas.   The food is always fresh and comes out hot just ready for you to take a bite out of it.  The smoothies are great as well.  I've tried the Chicken Mushroom sandwich which is on point.  Everything comes in huge portions.  Two people can eat the chicken sandwich and fries.  In addition the salads are great as well. When you go, check out the baha dressing that they make.  Its definitely one not to be missed.  Dip your fries in it and you won't go wrong!
so good! their veggie burger is delicous! and the waffle fries are great...
great smoothies, fast delivery, tasty sandwiches, great fries, this place is top notch for a quick bite.  I just wish they were open on Sundays.

This place really rocks.  I keep it pretty simple here sticking to the homemade hummus, grilled vegetables, goat cheese quesadilla, dolmades, and a few of the veggie sandwiches.  Their menu caters to everyone;  They have plenty to offer vegetarians, burger lovers, and health conscious folks - money savers or spenders.   Their hummus is homemade to order and the best I have ever had. I think their prices are fair and justified because in  most cases the portions are substantial.   Suggestion -  if you are carrying out definitely order before hand.  Because it is freshly made to order it does take a few (well worth it) minutes.

Great food, speedy delivery in the West Loop.  1st off- the home made waffle fried are delicious!!!! And plentiful.  The burgers are delicious!  Any of them.  The chicken sandwiches are good too.  And then there are the smoothies.  Very fresh, and very delicious, probably the most expensive things on their menus though. I've eaten in the place once, and the orders took so LONG to come up, and it's old and a bit run down in the teeny tiny dining room.  But when I order delivery, they are knocking on my door about 20 minutes after I order.  I love this place for burgers!!

My husband (a dedicated carnivore) and I (a dedicated vegetarian) get takeout from here at least once a week.  I'm in love with the charred asparagus sandwich (goat cheese, grilled asparagus, lettuce, tomato and dressing :) and waffle fries which are ALWAYS fresh ( a rarity at most restaurants).  This place is great because it also has fruit plates, salads and Fuze beverages to grab and go.  Oh, and the smoothies and juices are a hit as well!

I can't believe after how many times I've been here I haven't yelped it. One thing that kind of pisses me off about this place is that I always think it's called Jubilee Juice and then the fiancee and I go through about a minute of nailing down the name of this place. So lame, I know. I've never eaten here and we only do take out, so keep that in mind when you read my review. The turkey burger: fine but not really worth it. It's better to go somewhere else for it where they make their own burgers and it doesn't taste like a frozen patty.  With that being said, I still get it from time to time. All the other chicken sandwiches here are a hit.  The grilled chicken breast still retains it's juiciness and it travels well. Their smoothies here are really good and HUGE so prepare to share. Remember folks, sharing is caring.

While the food taste pretty excellent, the prices get to mount up when ordering for a bunch of people, especially with the smoothies.  The chicken burger is tastey and so is the bacon mushroom burger. As far as smoothies go, you are pretty guaranteed to get something good no matter what you order.  The service sometimes leave something to be desired, but hey, I'm not there to make friends.

The food is very tasty, but the food is overpriced for what you get.  They have a lot of creative options and a vast menu.  I was a little disappointed in the fix-ins that came on my wrap.  The chicken was good, but there was no cheese or seasoning.  For an $8 dollar wrap I expected a bit more.  Also I'm a bit turned off by the name.  I'm a huge Jamba Juice fan and it is too similar to Jamba.  I guess I should try their smoothies so I can compare, but it's tough to live up to Jamba.

The fries are good, where is the salt dispenser though? All I saw was ketchup.... Tried the Turkey Burger and the Blue Cheese burger, both good... not great but good..... It is a bit pricey for fast food I agree, $20 for lunch for two people...

I love Jubilee Juice! I use to work close by (yet we somehow always ordered) and the delivery is insanely quick and the guys were always nice (maybe because i'm pretty cute, but I digress). I LOVE the portabello and goat cheese sandwich and the fries that you can't eat just one of (I REALLY TRY). The smoothies are also pretty good and I hear the salads are great as well. But if you're gonna go then get the fries and a portabello and goat cheese sandwich....or else...

Perfect for the summer...try the razzleberry, it's the BEST!!! There are tons of food choices, mostly sort-of healthy, but all really yummy! But you are doing yourself a huge disservice if you don't try one of the many smoothie choices on the menu. Prices are reasonable and they deliver. Now if only the weather will get warmer.......

I love their Marinated Chicken and their Jubilee Chicken. These sandwiches are so juicy. Accompanied by some of their perfectly cooked waffle fries...its the best! The smoothies are pretty excellent too. My wife swears by their fresh made-to-order juices.

This place is really good. Its a little expensive for a fast food, but they have great stuff. I really like the baked sweet potato, the soups are good, and they have a veggie burger that is really good. They put Merkt's cheese on the burgers, which is great on a veggie burger. A good lunch spot.

Great sandwiches, tasty smoothies, delicious waffle fries.  Don't let the "hole in the wall" atmosphere discourage you.  The food here is VERY GOOD.  My favorite is the charred asparagus and goat cheese sandwich.
place is a little pricey, but worth it and the delivery times are amazing.  I feel like by the time I hang up the phone they are knocking on the door.
Their chicken sandwiches are great and their very solid in the french fry department.  They are a little more expensive than most fast food places but it's worth it.

Jubilee Juice is juicy!  (I'm not talking about the eastern European hotties that Jonesy was referring to in his review). I'm talking about the fresh squeezed juice offered at this fine establishment.... like the pear/apple juice I ordered during my last visit. I very much liked the fact that there were no pre-created fruit/veggie combinations - you can mix-mash your own juicy creation. Also! - and most importantly - the veggie burgers are excellent. The choice of cheeses is uber cool too! Last time I ate at the "Jube" I ordered goat cheese on mine - yummy!

Just ordered for lunch today at the office.  Ordered online, online process was quick and easy, but I was a bit worried since they make you post 60 mins from the time you order and usually businesses will take longer than the post time during the lunch-crunch.  I was pleasantly surprised!!  Food arrived in less than 20 mins and was super hot, tasted great, and was extremely fresh.  We will DEF order form here again.  Great find!

I used to go here all the time from work, down the street, and loved it.  The Buffalo chicken sandwich is great, the waffle fries are better.   They just lost two stars today, though.  I didn't have a menu and I just wanted to drop in quickly and pick up lunch on my way back to work from the gym.  I called in and ordered a Caesar salad with chicken and a regular pineapple/strawberry smoothie (strawberry craze) with protein powder.   I got there and my total was $16.50.  That's pretty expensive, although I ordered without a menu so it's my own fault for not checking how much everything was first.  Then I realized the woman gave me a garden salad rather than the Caesar I ordered.  I mentioned it to her and she asked if I wanted what I ordered instead but I didn't make a big deal out of it because I didn't think it could be that bad.  It was actually pretty nasty.  The dressing they gave me was one of those gelatinous Italian style dressings... it was really sweet, not my cup of tea.  That's a personal thing, agreed, but I was in the mood for Caesar dressing which couldn't be more different.  The lettuce was ripped up into such small pieces that it was impossible to get a fork poked into any of it.  It was just sort of annoying.  Lettuce, 2 cukes, 2 cherry tomatoes, 6 baby carrots and a piece of cut up chicken, $10.85.  It was a pretty big let down.   If I decide to go back I'll stick with the chicken and greasy waffle fries - I think that's where they excel.

I really, really love the chicken sandwiches here.  And I love that you can get real vegetables in meals, not just your average shredded carrrots, but grilled eggplants and stuff like that.  This is a favorite for quick, lazy dinner, withour feeling guilty.  Also portions are large enough for left overs.  One warning, check your order before you leave (I frequently get mistakes)...

The food is kick ass, and they have waffle fries that soak up the salt just right. There is certainly junk food (burgers, ruben, fried stuff) but they also have a very healthy menu, real good stuff that sticks to the ribs. Even some vegetarian items. But if you are in the mood for a smoothie you really have to go. The smoothies are so out of this world I sometimes get an upset stomach from drinking them so fast. I have never met the owner but there is usually three or four attractive girls there behind the counter and they all look like sisters. If you can get the real pretty one to make your smoothie, it's quite the show as she steadies the blender. Service is kind of bad and they can be a bit rude. Maybe it is because I just stare at them the whole time making smoothies.

Jubilee Juice is an attractive alternative to standard fast food chains, but it's also very hit or miss.  The hits include their chicken sandwiches.  They have three or four varieties including marinated, barbecued, and one with honey mustard.  All are very good and pretty well sized.  The burgers in my opinion are a miss.  I've had the regular hamburger and the turkey burger - I didn't care for either one at all.  The deli sandwiches are so-so.  The corned beef is very lean (good), but also very salty (not good).  Jubilee Juice seems to be famous for their smoothies.  I've tried two different smoothies and found both to be remarkably average.  I also don't like the fact that the smallest smoothie is about 24 ounces - that's way too much.  The smoothies at Love's are better and more appropriately sized.

I used to come here with a coworker all the time. I really enjoyed the veggie burger. It's huge! I really like the waffle fries too. My coworker loves the salmon sandwich. Turkey burger is good too. I really like the variety of the menu. Normally I would call in and then just pick it up. I find that it's much faster that way especially because the place is small and there's always a line. The smoothies are ok nothing special except the fact that they're huge.  I definitely feel the portions at this place are just way to big. Maybe that's why it's so expensive. I also took off a star because the eating area is so cramped. People on top of people. I'd rather eat in my car.

My office orders delivery from here for lunch at least once a week, and we've been doing that for over a year now.  Consistently good food, always speedy delivery.  Salads are huge, and like jesca c. says below, the grilled chicken is fantastic.  I would've given it 5 stars, but for a lunch joint it's a bit overpriced when you factor in the delivery charge plus tip.

A nice place that totally doesn't feel like overly clinical chains.  All I had was the lemonade which was excellent and freshly squeezed.  Can't say much else from my limited experience but it was a good place to cool off on a muggy day!

Have enjoyed everything I've had here--simple food, fresh & fast. Lots of options. Try the salads, smoothies and the amazing waffle fries. Not sure what they do to their grilled chicken, but it is fantastic. Perfect lunch spot.

One of our regular places for lunch --  - cheap (fairly) - healthy - deliver - tasty!!! I got so sick of the same old carry out.  Jubilee has a great amount of Veggie options such as : Goat cheese Asparagus sandwich, Roasted vegetables, a nice veggie burger, and my favorite 2 salads ever -  The Jubilee (blue cheese, walnuts, pears, raspberry vinegerette)  AND  The BBQ Baja Salad (avocado, black beans, corn, and a slightly spicy bbq dressing) Also ** They have fresh juice and wheat grass!!** This has saved me on tired, weak days at work... -Forget the coffee -Plug your nose -And shoot a double shot of wheat grass.. -You'll feel like a million bucks! My only complaints:  The salads are amazing, but you have to share them..there is literally enough lettuce to feed a rabbit farm...A  smaller salad option would be nice.  The women on the phone can be a bit snappy and rude. But who cares really, I'm just so happy it's near me for  lunch!!

Thank God I live nowhere near this place. I'd be 50 pounds heavier! I've yet to have anything I didn't like from this place - and I'm going on 7 years of love and patronage. Their waffle fries are awesome, their chocolate chip cookies are outstanding, their smoothies are killer... but their chicken sandwiches take the cake. The chicken breasts they use are HUGE (almost scary) and they do something with marinade that seals the deal. There is NOT a better chicken sandwhich in the city. There just isn't. Stop looking. Stop.
I used to eat here all the time when I worked in the area. The price is resaonable and the food is good.  I really liked their waffle fries. Pretty much everything that I've had there is good.

can i get an amen for jubilee juice? even though it sometimes takes awhile to get your food, it's always worth the wait. the sheer size and scope of the menu is utterly impressive, not to mention the high quality ingredients and such. A+!

I can live on grilled chicken sandwiches, and Jubilee's are the best I've ever had, by a wide margin.  The portion is huge, their "secret marinade" is delicious and sets them apart from anywhere else, and when you can get your choice of everything from field greens, goat cheese, or bacon on it, perfection becomes possible.  You can also get their famous grilled chicken (or other sandwich options like strip steak, ahi tuna, or halibut) as toppings on fresh, crisp salads.  If I'm getting something to eat, I get plain juice.  Fresh-squeezed orange juice is a revelation, and Jubilee makes theirs with whole oranges, absolutely key.  Having it once is enough to turn you off anything from a carton forever.    If I'm just having a smoothie, my favorite is the pina colada.  The smoothies that include the thicker, smoother Greek yogurt Jubilee uses are usually enough on their own to have for breakfast or as something light enough to have if you're hungry and planning on eating later.

Great quick place to grab a bite.  Whether you need to reign things in and just want the salad, or go all out with the sandwich/fries/smoothie deal, this place is great.   Jubilee is how fast food should be--It's ready quickly, and the food is fresh & delicious.  I don' think i've tried aything here that I didn't like... and yes, the fries are fantastic.
Fun, unpretentious decor, with sandwiches and smoothies. Decent for the price.

Came here craving soup since my friend recommended it - was a bit disappointed that they only had one type on hand but the cream of spinach was pretty good and I got this cranberry smoothie which was out of this world!
This place is very convenient for me cuz i go to UIC and can pop over on my way home!  I'm addicted to smoothies and love fresh fruit ones especially!
The food is really good if you like sandwiches. The smoothies aren't too bad either. They have a good variety of flavors and things you can add to make your drink healthy and good!

The turkey burgers at Jubilee Juice are unbelievably fantastic. Gigantic, too. Used to go there all the time when I worked in the area. Considering nearby parking is tricky, I no longer go there very often.

Wonderful smoothies, and sandwiches too. They make all drinks to order, so you can watch them put your fruit in. My husband loves this place. Prices are comparable to other smoothie places in the city.
